segment.source: Screen sizes and break points for responsive design
segment.target: Screen sizes and break points for responsive design

segment.source: The number of device targets and screen sizes across the Windows 10 ecosystem is too great to worry about optimizing your UI for each one.
segment.target: The number of device targets and screen sizes across the Windows 10 ecosystem is too great to worry about optimizing your UI for each one.

segment.source: Screen sizes and break points for responsive design
segment.target: Screen sizes and break points for responsive design

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: The number of device targets and screen sizes across the Windows 10 ecosystem is too great to worry about optimizing your UI for each one.
segment.target: The number of device targets and screen sizes across the Windows 10 ecosystem is too great to worry about optimizing your UI for each one.

segment.source: Instead, we recommended designing for a few key widths (also called "breakpoints"): 320, 720, and 1024 epx.
segment.target: Instead, we recommended designing for a few key widths (also called "breakpoints"): 320, 720, and 1024 epx.

segment.source: Tip When designing for specific breakpoints, design for the amount of screen space available to your app (the app's window).
segment.target: Tip When designing for specific breakpoints, design for the amount of screen space available to your app (the app's window).

segment.source: When the app is running full-screen, the app window is the same size of the screen, but in other cases, it's smaller.
segment.target: When the app is running full-screen, the app window is the same size of the screen, but in other cases, it's smaller.

segment.source: This table describes the different size classes and provides general recommendations for tailoring for those size classes.
segment.target: This table describes the different size classes and provides general recommendations for tailoring for those size classes.

segment.source: responsive design breakpoints
segment.target: responsive design breakpoints

segment.source: Size class
segment.target: Size class

segment.source: small
segment.target: small

segment.source: medium
segment.target: medium

segment.source: large
segment.target: large

segment.source: Width in effective pixels
segment.target: Width in effective pixels

segment.source: Typical screen size (diagonal)
segment.target: Typical screen size (diagonal)

segment.source: 13' and wider
segment.target: 13' and wider

segment.source: Typical devices
segment.target: Typical devices

segment.source: Phones
segment.target: Phones

segment.source: Tablet, phones with large screen
segment.target: Tablet, phones with large screen

segment.source: PCs, laptops, Surface Hubs
segment.target: PCs, laptops, Surface Hubs

segment.source: General recommendations
segment.target: General recommendations

segment.source: You can make navigation and interactions easier on hand-held devices by placing navigation and command elements at the bottom of the screen so that users can easily reach them with their thumbs.
segment.target: You can make navigation and interactions easier on hand-held devices by placing navigation and command elements at the bottom of the screen so that users can easily reach them with their thumbs.

segment.source: Center tab elements.
segment.target: Center tab elements.

segment.source: Set left and right window margins to 12 px to create a visual separation between the left and right edges of the app window.
segment.target: Set left and right window margins to 12 px to create a visual separation between the left and right edges of the app window.

segment.source: Use 1 column/region at a time
segment.target: Use 1 column/region at a time

segment.source: Use an icon to represent search (don't show a search box).
segment.target: Use an icon to represent search (don't show a search box).

segment.source: Put the navigation pane in overlay mode to conserve screen space.
segment.target: Put the navigation pane in overlay mode to conserve screen space.

segment.source: If you're using the master detail element, use the stacked presentation mode to save screen space.
segment.target: If you're using the master detail element, use the stacked presentation mode to save screen space.

segment.source: With Continuum for Phones, a new experience for compatible Windows 10 mobile devices, users can connect their phones to a monitor and even use a mouse and keyboard to make their phones work like a laptop.
segment.target: With Continuum for Phones, a new experience for compatible Windows 10 mobile devices, users can connect their phones to a monitor and even use a mouse and keyboard to make their phones work like a laptop.

segment.source: (For more info, see the Continuum for Phone article.)
segment.target: (For more info, see the Continuum for Phone article.)

segment.source: Make tab elements left-aligned.
segment.target: Make tab elements left-aligned.

segment.source: Set left and right window margins to 24 px.
segment.target: Set left and right window margins to 24 px.

segment.source: We recommend creating a visual separation between the left and right edges of the app window.
segment.target: We recommend creating a visual separation between the left and right edges of the app window.

segment.source: Up to two columns/regions
segment.target: Up to two columns/regions

segment.source: Show the search box.
segment.target: Show the search box.

segment.source: Put the navigation pane into docked mode so that it always shows.
segment.target: Put the navigation pane into docked mode so that it always shows.

segment.source: Put navigation and command elements at the top of the app window.
segment.target: Put navigation and command elements at the top of the app window.

segment.source: Make tab elements left-aligned.
segment.target: Make tab elements left-aligned.

segment.source: Set left and right window margins to 24 px.
segment.target: Set left and right window margins to 24 px.

segment.source: We recommend creating a visual separation between the left and right edges of the app window.
segment.target: We recommend creating a visual separation between the left and right edges of the app window.

segment.source: Up to three columns/regions
segment.target: Up to three columns/regions

segment.source: Show the search box.
segment.target: Show the search box.

segment.source: Put the navigation pane into docked mode so that it always shows.
segment.target: Put the navigation pane into docked mode so that it always shows.
